citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), EROS Data Center, Alaska Field Office
citeinfo.title: Landsat Mosaics for Alaska

descript.abstract: Data Type: Remotely Sensed Data; A series of 143 individual MSS Landsat satellite images pieced together to show the state of Alaska. These images are false-color mosaics showing two visible and two infrared data bands. The imagery is available in a choice of formats and prices, based on two photo-reproduction techniques. The first and higher quality product is made from the original mosaic by contact printing. The second method copies and reduces the products made by the first method. These copies are slightly lower in quality and greatly reduced in price. Hardcopy prints and 35mm slides only media available. This series is intended for general use by the public and scientists investigating minerals, geologic features and other natural features of Alaska.

idinfo.useconst: Resolution restricts use to regional applications only.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
